intro: Camaridium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered camaridium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and other related genera. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
